stream_context.summary: Kaze spends the session polishing a new Wild-West course: modelling NPCs (cowboy Shy Guys, Monty Moles, future Goombas), tweaking lighting, textures and pipes, and outlining its three sub-areas (town, desert outskirts, train station). He notes 120 stars are finished and the target is now 140.
level: Wild-West course (working titles discussed: "High Noon Hills", "Grand Sand Badlands", "Grandstand Badlands")

development_findings.summary: 120 stars are complete; team decided to add 20 more plus some overworld work, bringing the goal to 140.
development_findings.quote: 120 stars are finished now, but then we want 20 more stars.

development_findings.summary: Current focus is a Wild-West level with three zones: a town hub, a wilderness section full of oversized props, and a train-station arena.
development_findings.quote: The first area is actually like a proper town... the second area is just like the wildness with random oversized Wild West props... and the third area, that is the train station here.

development_findings.summary: Level will contain three outlaw stories, each ending in a boss fight (Snifit mine, stacked-Goomba train robbery, Monty Mole bank tunnel). This will be the only course with multiple bosses.
development_findings.quote: There's gonna be the sheriff's office here... secret room in the saloon... a shootout with a Snifit... five Goombas at the train robbery... and a Monty Mole cave where you have to do a boss fight.

development_findings.summary: Performance target is being met: the level runs "almost 60 FPS" on real N64 hardware.
development_findings.quote: This level is running pretty well in 64. It's like almost 60 FPS.

development_findings.summary: Shy Guy NPC was refactored for world lighting, given a hat, holster, new textures, shadow logic and tunable turn radius via bparams.
New pipe model was created; Biobak proposed smoother shading, but Kaze insists lighting must stay on for proper environment mapping.
development_findings.quote: If you have lighting off your environment map doesn't work and the pipe doesn't look proper in the world, so we need to keep lighting on.

development_findings.summary: Tests show f3dex3 microcode is ~20 % slower; team keeps the existing renderer for now.
development_findings.quote: F3DX3 right now is 20 % slower compared to what we have so we can't use F3D X3 for now.

development_findings.summary: Kaze pivots on modelling philosophy: triangle count optimisation is overrated; he is comfortable adding geometry where it helps visuals.
development_findings.quote: Triangle count is completely overrated... people keep telling me about triangle counts when it doesn't really matter much.

development_findings.summary: Atmospheric tumbleweed objects spawn near camera and roll across the scene to give the world more movement.
development_findings.quote: The tumbleweed is so good... gives the game like so much movement and vibe.

development_findings.summary: Plot tweak under consideration: replace original "Yoshi slave-labour" idea with a simpler kidnapping premise to keep tone light.
development_findings.quote: We might have to slightly reshape the story... the whole Yoshi slave labor plot is maybe a bit too dark.

context_findings.summary: Kaze claims he never suffers burnout because he sees himself as a ‘robot’ who just keeps working regardless of motivation.
context_findings.quote: No, I actually never suffer from burnout... that's because I do not have a soul.

context_findings.summary: His design philosophy favours disciplined work over inspiration: "Just do the thing" even when motivation is absent.
context_findings.quote: If you rely on motivation it's not gonna work. You just have to do the thing regardless of whether you want to or not.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: he and Zeina are expecting a child; he jokes about parenting and adoption if the kid mocks his UV maps.
context_findings.quote: What if my kid watches this in like 20 years... then shouldn't have called his UVs bad.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is ‘method acting’ the Western theme, watching many cowboy movies to stay in the mood.
context_findings.quote: The last two weeks have actually been crazy. I've been watching so many cowboy movies... Everything's just cowboys in my world right now.

context_findings.summary: He now multistreams to Twitch and YouTube after Twitch rule change.
context_findings.quote: Twitch changed the rules recently, so now you're allowed to stream on both at the same time.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback and alternate model for the new pipes, proposing smoother shading and different shine behaviour.
Sent belt texture for the Shy Guy vest and is modelling a Koopa bartender with tall hat and moustache.

zeina.summary: Modelled a dragon for an earlier treasure hunt area and is sculpting rocks and other Western assets by hand.
zeina.quote: So basically, there's a treasure hunt here... over there is a dragon. Zeina made the dragon, by the way.

zeina.summary: Currently building a cowboy Goomba model and supplied rock and cactus assets for the level.

key_stories.title: Building the Wild-West Course
key_stories.summary: Kaze set out to create a highly thematic Wild-West level featuring a town, desert outskirts and train-station shootout. He immersed himself in cowboy media, roughed out three outlaw missions and designed atmospheric touches like tumbleweeds and milk-only saloons. The area now runs near 60 FPS on real hardware and has its first star implemented.
key_stories.challenge: Deliver a fresh, coherent Western experience that still meets strict N64 performance limits.
key_stories.process: Broke the map into three zones; hand-modelled assets with Zeina and Biobak; added tumbleweed, new pipes, cowboy NPCs, and planned multi-boss structure.
key_stories.outcome: Level is playable, visually cohesive, and almost performance-locked; only naming, NPC population and final boss scripting remain.
key_stories.key_quote: I feel like recently I have leveled up a lot of my skills and this level is the first one that has those applied and I'm pretty happy with it.

key_stories.title: The Pipe Model Overhaul
key_stories.summary: A Tuesday bonus stream produced new pipe geometry. On this stream Biobak challenged the shading. Kaze insisted lighting stay on for environment maps, demonstrating real-hardware tests and adjusting combiners.
key_stories.challenge: Improve visual quality of pipes without sacrificing speed or correct environment reflections.
key_stories.process: Biobak supplied a variant; Kaze examined combiner settings, vertex colors and smooth shading, then justified keeping world lighting.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze keeps his version while incorporating shine tweaks; definitive pipe model added to asset library.
key_stories.key_quote: If you have lighting off your environment map doesn't work and the pipe doesn't look proper in the world, so we need to keep lighting on.

key_stories.title: Realising Triangle Count Is Overrated
key_stories.summary: While rebuilding the cowboy Shy Guy, Kaze concluded that obsessing over low triangle counts had little real impact compared to texture and combiner efficiency.
key_stories.challenge: Balance visual quality and performance on N64.
key_stories.process: He experimented with adding geometry to arms and holster, saw negligible frame-time cost, and publicly revised his stance.
key_stories.outcome: Team is now freer to add detail where it meaningfully improves silhouettes.
key_stories.key_quote: Triangle count is completely overrated... it doesn't really matter much.

open_questions.topic: Final name for the Wild-West course
open_questions.context: Multiple placeholders were brainstormed (High Noon Hills, Grand Sand Badlands, Grandstand Badlands) but no decision was made.
questions: What naming criteria will ultimately decide the level’s title?
How important are rhyme and alliteration to you?

open_questions.context: Current tests show it is 20 % slower; team stayed with existing renderer.
questions: What would need to change for you to migrate to F3DEX3?
Are there planned optimisations or custom hacks that could negate the slowdown?

open_questions.topic: Overworld plot revision (Yoshi slave labour vs. kidnapping)
open_questions.context: Kaze felt the original ‘slave-labour’ angle was too dark and suggested Bowser simply kidnaps the Yoshis.
questions: Has the story pivot been finalised?
How will this affect level intros and cut-scenes already built?

open_questions.context: The town already includes Toads, Yoshis, Shy Guys, Goombas, Monty Moles, Snifits and possibly Bandits.
questions: Is there a hard technical or design cap on distinct NPC races per level?
How do you avoid visual clutter while maintaining diversity?

open_questions.context: 120 of 140 stars finished; overworld still in flux.
questions: What is the projected beta and final release window?
What tasks remain on the critical path (overworld, extra stars, optimisation)?
